title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message:
I have this 2019 Pro that shows a very dim backlight (it's there but about 1/10 the brightness of normal). After a NVRAM reset, the backlight displays at full brightness during the first half of the boot process, then reverts back to dim.

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is constant around 44 V, before and after dimming.
BKLT_PWM is 2.5 V during full brightness, and 0.01V during dimming.

I don't have another 2018 display but I tested with a 2017 display and it gave the same results. What's next to check on this board?

2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message: Yes, I tried DFU Revive, which didn't change anything.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message: Save data (if needed) and do DFU restore, with full macOS installation.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message: Ok, did that. No change. As soon as the OS loads, the display dims.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message: I'm running all tests with camera flex cable disconnected... it's not the ALS for sure.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message: I (accidentally) found out that when I connect one or more of the LED return lines in the backlight flex cable to ground, the brightness (almost full) returns. Is that expected… is that how PWM works in these displays?

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message:
Shouldn't be LED return issue, if backlight is correct when machine starts.
Looks more like ALS issue, as its driver is loaded into macOS.

How did you discard an ALS problem located on the MLB?
Check if ALS really works; KB backlight reaction may help.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message:
You're right, it could be an ALS issue on the logic board. 

With the original 2018 display, I get constant keyboard backlight and screen brightness doesn't change with ambient light. Camera works.

title: 2018 Pro 820-00850 board with dim display output
message:
Found the culprit. Someone had installed a 2017 display (820-00452-05) on this machine. This explains the dimness and lack of ALS.

I tried a 2020 A2289 display and it functions perfectly.

Always test with a compatible screen! See [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/MacBook_LCD_Screen_Compatibility[/URL] for known screen issues.
